 Connecting to the Library with the VPN: Overview 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 What's in this Guide?
                                 
 
 
 
 This is a guide to help UCR students, staff and faculty understand the different methods of accessing UCR Library resources from off-campus.   
 Login via any of these requires a  UCR NetID and Password  (UCR email login and password). If you have challenges installing or using the VPN, please check  our FAQ . 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Ways to Connect
                                 
 
 
 
 
 GlobalProtect 
 Mobile 
 
 
 
 
 PaloAlto Network's  GlobalProtect  VPN client is the preferred method of accessing UCR resources remotely. GlobalProtect is a program you install on your computer or device to establish a VPN connection with UC Riverside. This allows you to remotely access campus resources (example: Library services) that are restricted to on-campus use.  
 
 Download and Install  the appropriate version of the GlobalProtect VPN from the  ITS VPN GlobalProtect Connection Installation Instructions  page.  
 Need more assistance?  Watch one of these  installation videos .  
 
 Connect : 
 
 Find the application on your computer and start it up. 
 URL: campusvpn.ucr.edu 
 Sign in: NetID and password 
 Verify: Using Multi-factor Authentication (MFA) (The  DUO Mobile App  is recommended) 
 
 
Once you are connected, open any browser to access library resources as if you were on campus.  If you are using applications that connect to UCR Library resources, such as EndNote or Zotero, use them as you would on campus as well. 
 
You will stay connected until you disconnect or until the server restarts. If you have challenges installing or using the VPN, please check  our FAQ . 
 
 
 
 
 To access materials through your mobile device, download the GlobalProtect VPN mobile application, available through app stores for Apple and Android.  
 
 Open the app and enter the portal address of ‘campusvpn.ucr.edu’ and select Connect. 
	Allow the GlobalProtect VPN to Send You Notifications and Add VPN Configurations  
 URL: campusvpn.ucr.edu 
 Sign in: NetID and password 
 Verify: Using Multi-factor Authentication (MFA) 
 Open your browser to search library resources 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Video Guides
                                 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 How to tell if you are connected
                                 
 
 
 
 
 You can get to UCR Library resources (some are included at the bottom of this box to make a quick check) 
 If you go to Google and type  what is my IP , the address will begin with 169.235 
 If you open the GlobalProtect application, you will see "Connected" under the world icon 
 
 
 
 Web of Science (WOS) from Clarivate 
 
 
 Academic Search Complete 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 When you are connected...
                                 
 
 
 
 When you are connected to the VPN, you have access to all of the Library's online resources. 
 From the Library home page, You can use any of our databases to find articles, you can access tens of thousands of ebooks and you the vast majority of our current (and much of our archival) journals. 
 
 
 UCR Library Website 
 
 
 
 
 
 UCR Library Catalog 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Troubleshooting / Questions?
                                 
 
 
 
 Tips for  Troubleshooting   
 If you need additional assistance please use the contact information listed below: 
 Staff and Faculty Help Desk 
Telephone:  951-827-3555  (8-5 M-F, Leave a message if they do not answer) 
Email:  helpdesk@ucr.edu 
 Student Help Desk 
Telephone:  951-827-6495  (8-Midnight M-TH, 8-5 Fri, and 1pm-Midnight Sun) 
Email:  helpdesk@student.ucr.edu 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Disconnecting
                                 
 
 
 
 To protect your privacy, consider disconnecting the VPN when you are not accessing UCR Library resources. 
 To disconnect, open the GlobalProtect window, and click on Disconnect
